member.summary: Represents an analyzer.

member.summary: Indicates whether analyzer will search fast forwardly.

member.summary: Indicates whether analyzer will explore penalized cases.

member.summary: Indicates whether analyzer will automatically adjust colors in searching experience.

member.name: P:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.ReorderOnMostConstrained
member.summary: Indicates whether analyzer will automatically adjust colors via constrainted priority.

member.summary: Indicates whether analyzer will force the first color as start.

member.summary: Indicates whether analyzer will randomize colors.

member.name: P:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.UsesBestFirstSearch
member.summary: Indicates whether analyzer will use best-first search (BFS) rule to check grid.

member.summary: Indicates the number of bottleneck limit.

member.summary: Indicatees the queue destroyer method.

member.summary: Indicates the queue empty checker method.

member.exception: Throws when the string is invalid.

member.summary: Add the current color bit flag to the regions adjacent to the current or goal position.

member.summary: To update node costs.

member.summary: Determine whether the current grid can move.
member.exception: Throws when the argument or is invalid.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.IsDeadend(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@,System.Byte)
member.summary: Indicates the current position is deadend.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.CheckDeadends(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@)
member.summary: Check for deadend regions of free-space where there is no way to put an active path into and out of it. Any free-space node which has only one free neighbor represents such a deadend. For the purposes of this check, current and goal positions coutn as "free".

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.IsForced(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Determine whether the puzzle is forced.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.IsFree(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Determine whether the specified coordinate value is free.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.FindForced(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@,System.Byte@,Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Primitives.Direction@)
member.summary: Find a forced color.

summary.para: Perform connected components analysis on game board.

This is a 2-pass operation: one to build and merge the disjoint-set data structures, and another to re-index them so each unique region of free space gets its own index, starting at zero. Returns the number of freespace regions.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.GetNextMoveColor(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState*)
member.summary: Pick the next color to move deterministically.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.MakeMove(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@,System.Byte,Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Primitives.Direction,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make a valid move.
member.param: Indicates whether the move is forced.
member.exception: Throws when the specified is exceeded the limit.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.GetFreedCoordinatesCount(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the number of freed spaces around coordinate x and y.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.GetFreedCoordinatesCount(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@,System.Byte)
member.summary: Get the number of freed spaces around coordinate x and y.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.CheckBottleneck(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@)
member.summary: Identify bottlenecks on narrow regions - created by a recent move of a color, then see if it renders the puzzle unsolvable.

member.name: M:Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.Analyzer.GetStrandedColors(Puzzles.Flow.Concepts.Grid@,Puzzles.Flow.Analytics.ProcessState@,System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check the results of the connected-component analysis to make sure that every color can get solved and no free-space is isolated.

member.summary: The core method to search, performing A* or BFS (best-first search) algorithm to find a solution.
